intro: Satureja pitardii, commonly known as Pitard's savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are fragrant, containing essential oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Satureja pitardii is often found in rocky soils and open woodlands, thriving in full sun.
